alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over dirt North Woods roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding and washouts of North Woods dirt roads. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected with additional showers tracking through the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Allagash Township and Saint Francis. - This will impact North Woods Dirt Roads including the St. Francis Road, T15 R9 Road to Deboullie Mountain and Hewes Brook Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
